Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Donna G
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean but not really what you saw on the Travel Channel. the inside pool wasn't kept cool and they had the doors open so it was just as hot inside as out and towels were in plastic bins. the veranda rooms were in the back of the hotel and overlooking trees and that was an extra charge over a regular room. we checked in on Tuesday and no one cleaned our room till Friday. I threw away 3 wash rags because they were dirty. there are so may other options on the strip for much less. also the doors are about 1 to 1 1/2 inch from the floor, not great. the beds were ok but had the old 70's bedspreads on them. finally the water pressure was fantastic but the tub water didn't go down. we will definitely try a different hotel for our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family suite with two queen rooms. The room was spotless. The outdoor pool was fabulous and we spent several hours there. We had a wonderful time from start to finish. We were greeted warmly each time we entered the lobby and the breakfast was great. This inn is within walking distance of several main attractions in Branson. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the 3 queen room and we absolutely loved it! The staff is very friendly, rooms are very clean, great indoor pool (which my children absolutely loved) and it's close to numerous attractions!! Will definitely stay here again. Two thumbs up to the entire staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home. Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Roger H
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff, to the breakfast ladies, to the owners you want find a place that works as hard to make you comfortable. The location is great. Easy access to everything. The price is great. Warm and friendly. For me, a chritian family doing hotels right. FYI. Indoor and outdoor pools. WOW

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Great Staff, Affordable, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: r o
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in one of the rooms that has not yet been renovated and found it to be very comfortable. The rooms are larger than an average hotel room in Branson and they are spotless! Thumbs up to the housekeeping crew at Southern Oaks! Our impression of Southern Oaks hotel in Branson was great from start to finish!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: jstrange1011
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a jacuzzi room. Very clean and comfortable. I've stayed at this motel with my family for over 10 years. Always great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, glad to know they are updating.”
Reviews.Author: Smlygrlfs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. My mother told me she has a friend who always stays so we decided to give it a chance. The price was $70, which was expected especially on a holiday but when we got there the hallway (we stayed in the indoor section) was very musky and it was in serious need of updates. When we got in the room, the tv was small, bed was hard, no fridge or microwave. The room was large it was seriously too expensive for the lack of ammemeites. The breakfast was "ok". It was a normal continental..pool was shallow but nice indoor. We ended up staying at another hotel the next night. It was $20 cheaper (cause they gave me discount) and had pillow top mattresses, 32" flat screen and micro and fridge. I am glad to hear y'all are upgrading your rooms cause they definitely need it! We may try again after the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Family of Four”
Reviews.Author: Christina B
Reviews.Content: We booked the family suite and it was great, very large, like an apartment instead of a hotel room. There were two adults and two kids, both age 11. The king bed in the main bedroom was great. The queen bed in the second bedroom might need a new mattress but otherwise very good. Only down fall is only one bathroom and for four people really need two baths. The rooms are clean and you have everything you need in the kitchen. Having a washer and dryer in the room is a plus! The air conditioner works great, very nice for a hot summer. Great location, easy in and out. Pools are nice and clean. The decor is a bit outdated but again it's all clean and that's important. I would hightly recommend this family suite for a family or someone staying awhile.

Reviews.Title: “In need of updating!”
Reviews.Author: fisher004
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Southern Oaks many times over the past 10 years, but stopped a few years ago. My sister-in-law and I decided to take the kids to Branson for a quick, inexpensive overnight visit, so I thought we'd give SO a try again. The clerk was very friendly and the lobby had recently been remodeled, compliments of the Travel Channel's Hotel Impossible. We stayed in a 3-queen room, since there were 5 of us. The common hallways are hot. Keys are still in use, instead of key cards, so we could only get 2 keys (we needed 3). As always, the room was large and clean. The sheets, however, must have been the same ones from years ago, as were the towels. They were thin and scratchy. New sheets are needed! Same for the towels. A coffee maker is provided, as was a mini frig (in the 3-Q room, but not double rooms). Our AC worked well, and the room cooled off. The television was very small, and old style. In such a large room, a larger (32"?) flat screen would have been wonderful. We went down for the free continental breakfast at 9:05 (it was open until 9:30 am). They were out of donuts, cinnamon rolls, and hot biscuits, although the attendant did offer to make us biscuits. The regular coffee was also empty, and she did make us fresh. Still available was bread to toast (no bagels), cereal, and a bowl of not-too-great-looking canned fruit. We were disappointed. We had 3 kids with us, and all wanted donuts. The clerk also vacuumed while we were eating, including under our feet, which was somewhat annoying. We were the only people eating the entire time, so this could have waited. Overall, if you want a clean, relatively inexpensive (our room was $80) hotel room, and don't mind old amenities, then SO fits the bill. I hope the hotel owners will put some much needed TLC into this property and update the rooms. Hotel Impossible did a prototype guest room for them, and hopefully, they will remodel every room to match. The breakfast needs a little work. The swimming pools are great, although the indoor pool area was extremely hot and it felt like the heater was on. The location is great, and staff was very helpful and friendly. We will wait until a bit of remodeling is done before we return, but it IS clean!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is wonderful, beautiful and maintains great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: mrskirk
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Great parking, wonderful employees, clean rooms, great value, and the indoor pool is gorgeous. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “s.d.fitzpatrick”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: we were down for a family reunion the room was very clean the staff was friendly and very helpfull . my wife and I will stay at southren oaks inn the next time we are in branson.. we have stayed here before and have always had a great time. we are looking foward to seeing you all on hotel impossible monday june 4 at 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice Clean Place to Stay"”
Reviews.Author: daisy66617
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the better motels to stay at in Branson. The rooms are always clean and they are larger than most motel rooms. They have very good cinnamon rolls for breakfast and the breakfast lady is so nice and helpful. One of my favorite things about this motel is that there is a basement in one of the buildings so in case you are there in terrible tornado weather, you can at least feel safe in the basement (yes, I am from Kansas and I like to have a basement for protection). Just an overall great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean place”
Reviews.Author: tudorrose05
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay here every year in June. Very easy to get in and out of traffic wise. The rooms are a little bigger than your average hotel room. The rooms are always clean. One of the best things about this place is the people that work there are always friendly and helpful. The woman that works in the breakfast room is always so nice. Basicly if you want a clean, nice size room with friendly people stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug31903
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Southern Oaks at least 10 times now. It's true, it is not in it's prime, but you really cannot beat that price! We chose SO because of its location--it doesn't take long to get to silver dollar city from here. The biscuits and gravy are the best thing on the breakfast buffet, but get there before they run out!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: miz_kitty98
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay..Easy check in and check out. Large Clean room (with no horrible smells) Good location with no traffic noise. Cold AC...Didn't use the pool or hot tub but both looked very clean....The only thing I didn't like was the shower head it was too low but we will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I will choose another hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: kittykimbrough
Reviews.Content: Staff was not friendly during check-in. Our room was directly across the hall from the indoor pool. Our door did not touch the floor! It was about an inch to short. We had to shove a towel against the door! Rooms are not sound proof AT ALL. The people above us stomped around until nearly 2 AM. We were miserable. Breakfast was okay - nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “One night -great!”
Reviews.Author: PeachesandJ
Reviews.Content: Me and my 7 yr old granddaughter stayed here one night. The room was large and clean with a window overlooking the parking lot where I could keep an eye on the car - a plus. The indoor pool was freezing and the outdoor pool was just fine. Love the location. No problems - good price (I always ask for available discounts - like military) - Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As always!”
Reviews.Author: stretchmo
Reviews.Content: Once again we were very happy with our stay at Southern Oaks Inn. We have stayed at this property many times and as always were very satisfied. The property is well maintained. Our kids love the indoor pool(very clean).From the front desk help to maintenance to the nice ladies who cook the breakfast we appreciate it and they should all be praised. Bottom line is if you want luxury stay at the Chateau if you want value and comfort my opinion is you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Always love staying here”
Reviews.Author: Dwatsonhq
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I'm in Branson. Love my veranda room and the pools. Staff is always friendly and responsive and our is easy tho get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, Here's what we thought....”
Reviews.Author: Bev41
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was concerned, but decided to give it a try. Here's what we found.....The hotel is a typical Branson hotel -- somewhat dated, but affordable. I can be picky about clean hotel rooms, but our room was clean and was large. The mattresses in our rooms (we had two) were new and not too soft or too hard. As another person mentioned, the odd thing was that they didn't allow irons in the room, but we were close to the laundy room/ironing station so that didn't cause a problem. We didn't try the inside pool, but the outdoor pool was clean. One reviewer said the shower head was short and they were right on target, but on the flip side, we had plenty of hot water and the water pressure was excellent. Would I stay again --sure! Folks need to keep in mind if they want a trendy, new hotel they need to pay more than the $60 that this hotel charged. For the money, it was an okay place to stay. Plus, we loved the location. Off Highway 76 so we could use the alternative routes and didn't have to fight traffic to get to our hotel. We didn't try the breakfast bar so can't rate that.. We could hear noise from the upstairs, but nothing that kept us up. When I stay again, I'll ask for an 2nd floor room.

Reviews.Title: “okay place”
Reviews.Author: Chris2828
Reviews.Content: This was a okay place, some stuff good be better,like the beds..There sign says new beds but the beds we had where not new. They where as hard as the floor and the pillows where flat..The rooms where clean and big rooms.And the price was good for around 50 a night..They do need to add afew more items to there breakfast..They do have a indoor and outdoor pool but the indoor pool was cold. So we use the outdoor pool. But the pools where clean and went from 3ft to 5ft and didnt close down untill 11:45.. But it was a clean place to stay and that is a plus in my book..

Reviews.Title: “Just a basic place to spend the night or weekend”
Reviews.Author: ustravelinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Southern Oaks Inn over ten times in the past few years. Rooms with two queens will usually cost around $65. All the corridors are indoor. The location is right on the strip, but most rooms are far enough away that there's not much road noise. The rooms are outdated, but clean and most are bigger. There is an indoor and outdoor pool. They are usually both pretty cold even though they are advertised as heated. I told the staff they needed to turn the heat up because the water was freezing, but they said they didn't have a key to the pool maintenance room and basically refused to turn it up. I stayed at this hotel mainly because of the pool and was disappointed by this. Also, the pool is not cleaned much..you can scrape your name in the scum on the tile sides. Also, the hot tub has been broken for a while. The breakfast biscuits and gravy are okay. Overall, it is not in it's prime anymore. I will be looking for a different place to stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bigasufan
Reviews.Content: We are in our second day of a three day stay here. It has been a very enjoyable experience. The beds were firm (the way we like it). The room was clean and the shower is one of the very best we're ever had in a motel room. The indoor pool is very nice and they supply towels. The outdoor pool has not been opened yet as it is still quite cool. The room has been promptly cleaned, the TV is a big flat screen, and the continental breakfast was very good. I can honestly say that the ONLY negative is that they do not have or allow irons in the room. They say it's for fire prevention purposes. It's sure not something that will keep me from coming back. We're thoroughly enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This was HORRIBLE & DIRTY!”
Reviews.Author: wilsonslovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We expected a "value" motel - nothing fancy but a basic, clean room and comfortable bed. We did not get it! In Branson you can find alot of "mom & pop" type of hotels for $29-$39 a night, so for $70. a night I was expecting something better. The room appeared large but dated. Seriously, there was room for a couch and a kitchenette - so it looked sparse with only 2 beds, a dresser and a table and chairs. The tub looked very old - the worst part was that it had long black hair smeared all over the side of the wall - gross! We didn't discover that until we were showering the next morning, or we would've checked out immediately. The shower head is about chest high, approx 4 feet from the bottom of the bathtub - so it's great for kids or really short people. The floor didn't appear to have been vacuumed b/c there were plastic remnants of price tags that hadn't been vacuumed up. The sheets were cheap and thin, and there were no blankets on the bed so for warmth you have to use the disgusting old bedspread that does NOT get washed between guests. The breakfast was mediocre. They offered cream gravy and biscuits and what they described as really good cinnamon rolls (which they weren't), they had cold cereal and instant oatmeal. The 2 elderly ladies that kept up with breakfast seemed nice but they couldn't keep up with the supply of food needed and the line was out the door of the "Garden Room" (code for basement) which was a hike to find. There were even signs reading "Almost There!" b/c it was so inconvenient. I do not recommend staying on the bottom (1st) floor b/c they apparently decided to save money by placing no insulation between the floors - we were awoken early to the sound of children jumping/running/hopping/skipping- basically coming through the ceiling. We called the front desk but they acted like it was a hassle to contact the guests. I knew we were getting a bare-bones hotel, but this was BAD. I expect a clean room, decent bedding, and that's about it. This was Disgusting- with a capital D! I kinda felt scuzzy when I left....Keep looking...but in Branson, unless you stay at a chain hotel, you often get this type of room. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY FAST!”
Reviews.Author: Crimsonsunset
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! Don't even think about it! We made reservations with a big Branson Travel Agent. They made everything right in the end... BUT... My husband and I walked into the lobby and were unimpressed! Then when we got to our room with terrible directions... we unpacked our car, and 3 year old. Then we couldn't stand it any longer! There was an air freshner in there that was vanilla, I think. But it was one of those STRONG automatic ones, that went off every 5 minutes or so. Room was spacious. But the scent made our allergies go crazy! We called the travel company, and packed up the car. We ended up in Cascades, for a little bit more... but so much better! Oh and the hot tub is broken for over a year and they have NO INTENTION of fixing it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good combination of value, location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ozarkbound
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Southern Oaks Inn over 15 times over the past ten years. The staff has always been friendly, the rooms clean and the location is excellent, being within walking distance of numerous shows/IMAX, without the noise of the Main Strip. My friends have always enjoyed the indoor pool/hot tub. You can always find cheaper rooms, and u can always find more expensive ones also. Probably one of the best price/value hotels in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “pretty outdated”
Reviews.Author: BransonSince1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Will not stay again. Clean enough, but worn and outdated. One small window in room with view of only cars in parking lot. Worst controls to shower of any motel we have stayed in. Robe hook broken off door. Breakfast room down in basement. Garden room name is a joke. Food was okay, but food stations very disorganized. Not enough room or tables.

Reviews.Title: “not what is advertised”
Reviews.Author: DaytripperNwAr
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in the Branson with a HEATED OUTDOOR pool and the Southern Oaks website stated that they had one. My kids love to swim but an outside pool in September is a little cool at night - which is when we finally get around to the pool activities so a heated pool was a must. I phoned the hotel and inquired about rates and reservations. I asked the age of the hotel and they said the building itself was about 20 years old but that all of the rooms had been updated. I looked at the photos offered online and they 'appeared' to be newer furnishings so I booked two rooms for a 3 night stay. The rooms may have been updated at one point but I don't believe the rooms we stayed in have been updated in the past 10-15 years. Also, the outside pool was NOT heated so after jumping into a cool pool the first night our kids were not interested in swimming any other time we were there. There are sooooo many hotels in Branson now. I think if I had done just a little more research I could have found another hotel that acutally had a heated outdoor pool. And if not we could have stayed in a newer hotel and just done without the pool instead of staying in an old one. I will say that the rooms are very spacious and I didn't notice much noise. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay and don't really care about the age of the place - I would recommend this hotel for you. If you are like me and prefer newer furnishings and updated rooms where you are not afraid to walk on the carpet barefoot - I would not recommend this hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: u1662u
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by stating this was an extremely clean, comfortable hotel without being "fancy" or unreasonable with price. It fit our needs perfectly with both an indoor and outdoor pool. It's off the main strip, yet it is amazingly easy to get to and from all of the attractions and shows once you learn some of the back roads (it took us about a half a day). And the staff was more than accommodating; they actually gave us a tour of the hotel before we booked with them. Why did we stay here? We were initially booked (through a travel agency) a hotel right next door. When we arrived in Branson and checked into our hotel... lets just say the "Quality" was less than desirable; we checked out a few minutes later. Instead of running all over town trying to find another "name brand" hotel... we walked next door to the Southern Oaks Inn. I am so glad we decided to check it out. We were nothing but pleased with the room, the pool, and the service. Thank you Southern Oaks Inn for taking us in all week on such short notice. I'd recommend this Hotel to Everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Southern Oaks!”
Reviews.Author: laracegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Southern Oaks. We were in the last building by the indoor pool. The rooms are well used, can use some remodeling but overall were very clean. We put our maid sign out everyday and our rooms were cleaned everytime. We enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub. On the weekend it was always full, but during the week it wasnt crowded at all, and there was always plenty of towels. We ate breakfast there every morning, donuts, biscuits and gravy. We had refrigerators in our rooms for an extra charge, but worth it. The hotel staff was always friendly. We were in the interior corridors. I took full advantage of their guest laundry. It was always quiet and we did not hear any of our neighbors. We will be staying here again for Thanksgiving. Location is great and easy to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: DKforTravel
Reviews.Content: The Southern Oaks used to be a decent place to stay. Not anymore! Rooms are in terrible need of a refurb. Our room had a smell to it upon entering. We were completely missed by housekeeping on a Saturday. I called to the desk at 1:30 pm, and I was assured I would get service, they were just running behind. We returned to our room at 10:30pm that night, still untouched by housekeeping. I called the front desk and the worker said she was alone and I would have to bring my dirty towels up to her and she would give me fresh ones. The pool never had towels availabe in the tub designated "pool towels", by the way. Upon check out, I spoke to a manager and she really didn't care to seem to make things better. There are plenty of other place to stay in Branson, and I will never stay at this place again. It has turned into a dive, beware!

HotelInfo.Name: Southern Oaks Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3295 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
